intro: Machaeranthera frutescens, commonly known as the pink coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy pink to purple flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Machaeranthera frutescens is often found in prairies, open woods, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
